isis.stitle: TSI 07-12-01 - International® Diesel Engine Service Publications Application Guide

subjectgroup.subject: International® Diesel Engine Service Publications Application Guide

geninfo.para: International® Diesel Engine Service Publications are available in print, on the ISIS® system of the Dealer Communications Network II, and on Quarterly Revision Renewal System CD's. Most are available in print by contacting:

note.para: On ISIS®, if French or Spanish is selected and these manuals are not available, the English manual will be shown.

geninfo.para: The following tables can be used to identify which manuals are to be used when servicing specific International® engines. These tables do not include every engine service publication available. For complete availability and pricing, contact the International® order desk.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Explanation of service publication numbering (arrow indicates base number variable column)

calloutgroup.callout1: ES = Either an Engine Service or Diagnostic manual, ED = Engine Diagnostics form
Revision of base number, applies only to that specific publication
Base number ends in either 0 or 5 = English version
Base number ends in either 1 or 6 = Spanish version
Base number ends in either 2 or 7 = French version
Example: VT 365 Service Manual, Spanish version, no revision

svcproc.title: Language Translation Availability and Identification (2000 MY and later)
svcproc.para: By knowing the English base number of a particular service publication or diagnostic form, the Spanish or French version can be determined.

When searching for a V8 service manual for the International® VT 365 in Spanish, first look through table 6 to find the English EGES-235-2. This publication's base number is 235. Spanish translations are always one whole number higher than the English version base number as follows:
English base number ends in 0, Spanish base number ends in 1
English base number ends in 5, Spanish base number ends in 6
French translations are assigned base numbers that are two whole numbers higher than the English version base number as follows:
English base number ends in 0, French base number ends in 2
English base number ends in 5, French base number ends in 7

svcproc.title: Language Translation Availability and Identification (1999 MY and earlier)
svcproc.para: Translations for early engine publications were identified by adding an alphabetic suffix to the base manual number and revision level. Examples include:
EGES-160-1-S - First revision of Spanish version of EGES-160

svcproc.title: Publication Revisions
svcproc.para: Revisions are indicated by an additional digit after the 3-digit base number. The higher the digit, the higher the level of revision. Absence of a revision digit indicates the publication is at its original base (non-revision) level.

Revision levels can be out of phase for a particular publication series having English, Spanish and French versions. Therefore, the existence of a revised English version does not imply that there is a corresponding revised Spanish or French version.
Occasionally, revisions are available only on ISIS®. This occurs when recent corrections or changes are made but they are not yet available in print.
